history.content:
If there is space in the class, see @2571.

If there isn't: since you can't get into the class, you will be skipped over on the waitlist, yes.

children.subject:
That's not how the waitlist works.

When there is open space in the class, the system checks to see who the first student $$S$$ on the waitlist that can enroll is. (It'll look to make sure there are no enrollment restrictions on the open seat blocking $$S$$, that there is open space in the section $$S$$ is waitlisted for, and that $$S$$ has no time conflicts. Maybe some other checks.)

This may be the first student on the waitlist, or it may be the second, or the tenth, or w/e.

In your case, due to your conflict, you will never qualify to be enrolled in the class, and will always be skipped.

There is no "position 0" on the waitlist.

The standard SIS petition for conflicting classes seems to only appear when you attempt to enroll for a class you are conflicted for, and not when you are waitlisted. Thus, this petition won't appear

The form that I linked in @2571 is only applicable if there is open space in the class that you can get into (i.e. you satisfy all of the requirements to enroll other than having a time conflict). Currently, you would have to wait for everyone else on the waitlist to get in (or to also be unable to get in) before it makes sense to fill out this form.

So, you should probably switch discussions, yes.

I'm not sure what you mean by "space in the class". I am on the waitlist so I will eventually move up to position 0 on 151. Then it will try to enroll me in 151. However 151's lecture conflicts with my 120 discussion time. Will I then get a google form to fill out to override the conflict? Or do I need to switch discussion sections to get in?

history.content: You're correct, unless you follow the steps laid out for conflicting courses in our pinned note, you will never be able to advance from #1 on the waitlist (0 will never happen)

I am currently waitlisted for EECS 151 at position 3. But the lecture time conflicts with the time of my EE120 discussion. When I move up to position 0 on the 151 waitlist, will it drop me back down without enrolling me if there is a conflict? I was simply planning on enrolling in that discussion and going to the other one (which is full right now) to avoid being waitlisted for 120.

Thanks,

Ananth
history.subject: Policy on Waitlist
